intro: Ruyschia jimenezii, commonly known as the Jimenez's ruyschia, is a rare and striking plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, colorful bracts that surround its small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ruyschia jimenezii is considered a species of conservation concern.
